com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.viewstate.lce

Class MvpLceViewStateFragment<CV extends View,M,V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.MvpFragment<V,P>
        • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.lce.MvpLceFragment<CV,M,V,P>
          • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby3.mvp.viewstate.lce.MvpLceViewStateFragment<CV,M,V,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P,LceViewState<M,V>>, MvpLceView<M>, MvpView

    public abstract class MvpLceViewStateFragment<CV extends View,M,V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends MvpLceFragment<CV,M,V,P>
implements MvpLceView<M>, MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P,LceViewState<M,V>>
    A MvpLceFragment with ViewState support.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected LceViewState<M,V> viewState
      The viewstate will be instantiated by calling MvpViewStateDelegateCallback.createViewState() in MvpLceFragment.onViewCreated(View, Bundle).

      abstract M getData()

    • Field Detail

      • viewState

        protected LceViewState<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>> viewState
        The viewstate will be instantiated by calling MvpViewStateDelegateCallback.createViewState() in MvpLceFragment.onViewCreated(View, Bundle). Don't instantiate it by hand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MvpLceViewStateFragment

        public MvpLceViewStateFragment()

    • Method Detail

      • getMvpDelegate

        protected FragmentMvpDelegate<V,P> getMvpDelegate()
        Description copied from class: MvpFragment
        * Get the mvp delegate. This is internally used for creating presenter, attaching and detaching view from presenter.

        Please note that only one instance of mvp delegate should be used per fragment instance.

        Only override this method if you really know what you are doing.

        Overrides:
        getMvpDelegate in class MvpFragment<V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        FragmentMvpDelegateImpl

        Description copied from interface: MvpLceView

        Parameters:
        e - The Throwable that has caused this error
        pullToRefresh - true, if the exception was thrown during pull-to-refresh, otherwise false.

        Description copied from interface: MvpLceView

      • setRestoringViewState

        public void setRestoringViewState(boolean restoringViewState)
        Description copied from interface: MvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        This method will be called by MvpViewStateInternalDelegate to inform that restoring the view state is in progress.
        Specified by:
        setRestoringViewState in interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,LceViewState<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>>>
        Parameters:
        restoringViewState - true, if restoring viewstate is in progress, otherwise false

      • isRestoringViewState

        public boolean isRestoringViewState()
        Specified by:
        isRestoringViewState in interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,LceViewState<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>>>
        Returns:
        true if the viewstate is restoring right now (not finished yet). Otherwise false.

      • onViewStateInstanceRestored

        public void onViewStateInstanceRestored(boolean instanceStateRetainedInMemory)
        Description copied from interface: MvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        Called if the ViewState instance has been restored successfully.

        In this method you have to restore the viewstate by reading the view state properties and setup the view to be on the same state as before.

        Specified by:
        onViewStateInstanceRestored in interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,LceViewState<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>>>
        Parameters:
        instanceStateRetainedInMemory - true, if the viewstate has been restored from memory, otherwise false (viewstate has been restored from Bundle)

      • onNewViewStateInstance

        public void onNewViewStateInstance()
        Description copied from interface: MvpViewStateDelegateCallback
        Called if a new ViewState has been created because no viewstate from a previous Activity or Fragment instance could be restored.

        Typically this is called on the first time the Activity or Fragment starts and therefore no view state instance previously exists

        Specified by:
        onNewViewStateInstance in interface MvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>,LceViewState<M,V extends MvpLceView<M>>>

      • showLightError

        protected void showLightError(java.lang.String msg)
        Description copied from class: MvpLceFragment
        The default behaviour is to display a toast message as light error (i.e. pull-to-refresh error). Override this method if you want to display the light error in another way (like crouton).
        Overrides:
        showLightError in class MvpLceFragment<CV extends View,M,V extends MvpLceView<M>,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

      • getData

        public abstract M getData()
        Get the data that has been set before in MvpLceView.setData(Object)

        It's necessary to return the same data as set before to ensure that ViewState works correctly

        Returns:
        The data
